Reviews.Title: “Say Goodbye to a Grand Lady”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl59
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here while she auditioned at DePaul, and it was a key element of a wonderful weekend in Lincoln Park, from the ambience of this historic hotel to all the great dining and retail options nearby to the lake views out the window. We were upgraded to the Presidential Suite, which was vast and lovely in a faded way. The furniture was a little frayed around the edges if you looked but everything was very clean, including the kitchen and bath. There's a big living room, dining room, bedroom with two queen beds and two - count 'em, two - bathrooms. And a full kitchen with dishwasher. It was fun wondering if visiting Chicago celebrities had stayed there back in the day. The breakfast was rolls, bagels, cereals, etc., nothing hot but that was okay. All of this seems rather irrelevant because the desk clerk told us the building has been sold and the hotel portion is shutting down soon. It will all be condos. So if you want to stay here, make a reservation soon or you will be out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: green331
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in order to be close to DePaul, where my daughter had an interview. The neighborhood in the area was charming. Besides the college, there were a number of restaurants and interesting sites to visit within walking distance. Our room was comfortable with plenty of space. Parking was a bit tricky, but we managed to get a spot along the street and kept our car there during the rest of our stay (walking everywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Belden-Stratford - Suite Life”
Reviews.Author: Chris0329
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work - scheduled meetings in Lincoln Park - my travel department booked me at the Belden-Stratford. It was a wonderful old-time hotel ... which also functions as an apartment rental. They put me in a 3-room suite - it had to be at least 1,000 SF - with a great view of downtown. From the 8th floor, I could see the Hancock Building, Navy Pier, Lakeshore Drive. Rate was only $129/night. I had very nice dinner at Mon Ami Gabi - which is just off the hotel lobby. I was able to walk to and from my meetings on Halstad. The only downside was they did not have my reservation in their system when I arrived. I provided a copy of my confirmation and they gladly honored the reservation. Maybe that's why they put me in the gigantic suite.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB!”
Reviews.Author: SEA S
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here since 2007. We have to visit Childrens Hospital and the Hospital suggested the Belden. It is beyond superb! They are so friendly, the room are small apartments and it is a 8 min taxi to downtown Or you can walk for 15 min on a gorgeous day thru beautiful Parks. We get a hospital shuttle or the BellHops get you a taxi right away. Will stay here again and again! There is a nice sun deck but no pool. There is a spa and small workout room.

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice from now on!”
Reviews.Author: Mary47
Reviews.Content: It was our first stay here, on Thanksgiving weekend. We received a room upgrade and loved our spacious 9th floor unit with a view of the lake. It was the quietest hotel room we have ever had. The holiday decorations were lovely. The location was perfect, easy access to lake shore running paths, close to the zoo and conservatory, and a very short walk to a bus that goes straight down Michigan Ave. We hope to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Belden Stratford Hotel, Lincoln Park - Chicago”
Reviews.Author: libbypomroy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belden Stratford over my daughter's spring break. It is a fabulous location, near the lake, directly across the street from the Lincoln Park Zoo, and in the heart of Lincoln Park. We put our car in the valet parking and got around on foot, by bus and used a few taxis. It was a great bargain for downtown Chicago. Lincoln Park Zoo is a free attraction, and we visited the zoo twice during our visit. The hotel is walking distance to good shopping and restaurants. We booked tickets at the Royal George theater, also within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was quite small, but clean. The little kitchenette was handy. We had a nice view of the lake. The building is a combo of rental apartment units and some units rented as hotel space. I would stay here again -- loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: amesiowaconehead
Reviews.Content: I love this place. The staff is wonderful and the views could not be more lovely. It is steps away from a park and the neighborhood is one I would love to live in. You have the best of Chicago right out your window, and within.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: joekoliver
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with a bit of character. The rooms with full kitchen and bathroom are large and very comfortable with good in room facilities. The breakfast area downstairs did not impress initially but we got used to it especially after we had sampled the wide choice of continental breakfast items. The staff were friendly and very helpful when we required help to locate places. The location is superb and it was a joy to walk through the zoo(free) and Lincoln Park when heading in the direction of the beach or to join the Magnificent Mile. There are great photo opportunities in the Park with the background of the city skyscrapers. It was very easy to take the bus from just outside the hotel to head downtown. Compared to the selection, location and prices of other hotels in Chicago the value for money was outstanding and would probably be the best single reason for choosing this hotel. An eating place close by with lots of character is Grunts (5 minutes walk) which has a reasonable selection of dishes and a huge salad bar. Don't be put off with it described as a burger bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations/ Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkay1111
Reviews.Content: I pretty much agree with what everyone else has already said. . . Our room was large and well decorated. We had a full size kitchen. The price was very, very reasonable. The cleanliness was not perfert but certainly acceptable. The staff was not quick to help, but friendly and helpful when asked. I abosolutely LOVED the location. This is going to be my new "go to" hotel when I'm visiting Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel, in the old European style”
Reviews.Author: sandyjMoraira
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part hotel, part apartments, and we were upgraded to a suite each time we stayed. It is old fashioned, in a beautiful way. Some might say it needs updating, but I love high ceilings, huge murano glass lamps, lots of dark wood, and Huge rooms. Ours had a bedroom, lounge, kitchen and bathroom, with great views of the lake, over Lincoln park. It is a short (15min) bus ride to the city centre, but walking distance to the Zoo, park, lakeshore, Nature board walk, and Clark Street restaurants. Yes it is dated, but for the price, I think it was great. Continental breakfast was included, and although the breakfast area is very small, you can take it up to your suite, and with lake views, we did just that. The reception staff leave a little to be desired, not rude, but definately didnt put themselves out too much. Kept personal conversations going while dealing with clients, not knowledgeable, about the restaurants in the area. But, having said that, we were checked in , and out in minutes, no fuss, and the bell-boy was friendly, and brought our bags up (and down) immediately. We arrived very early,well before check-in time, and were given a complimentary continental breakfast. I would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overwhelming lobby, skimpy elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Nauplion
Reviews.Content: I was immediately disappointed, arriving exhausted from the airport, to have no one open the front door to me where I was maneuvering three bags, & limping, and no one helped me get them up the several steps to the lobby level. The lobby was quite grand and worthy of admiration, but arriving in such inconvenience and fatigue, I didn't feel like admiration. The registration was smooth, but I was given two room keys which worked badly & had to be replaced. Room was fine -- intended as a live-in, cook-in suite for a long visit, but I wouldn't want a long visit. Inadequate electric plugs for the computer which required my pulling out furniture and rearranging lamps and clocks.. No trashcan in the bedroom or near the desk. No information in the room about food in the hotel, or where to get food for the kitchen. No information that there were drink and snack machines in the basement. No information that us with bad knees could get to breakfast by another elevator & not have to walk down an imperial staircase. A coffeeshop serves a complimentary breakfast. Dimly lit. Minimal contributions, badly arranged so that you have to go to three different areas to put together a bowl of cereal. (Except for Rice Crispies, everything was colored sugar cereals.) Coffee was lukewarm No soy milk for those of us who can;t handle milk well, and it was really distressing in that dim light to discover I had been using a spoon with a good streak of purple lipstick. The bistro on the premises is most pleasing, and has fabulous onion soup. A boring, flavorless petite salad.. Terrific hot bread & butter. Good wine. Altogether a place to go on a chilly evening when exhausted. Meal was $25 for wine/salad/soup, & well worth it. Very good service, unstuffy.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
Reviews.Content: It was nice stay and I liked it very much mostly because of the value for the suite the hotel provided me with. Certainly the furniture was not new, in fact, most of the things are very worn out. But the fact that the rooms had kitchens, the size of the living room, dining room and bedroom, including the hotel locating made the difference. I do recommend to choose this hotel especially when you go to Chicago for fun. The only tip I'd give is if you go to the airport in the morning hours, make sure you pre-arrange the taxi - we spent extra 10 minutes just hunting for a car!

Reviews.Title: “Has the potential to be Great”
Reviews.Author: Sarah G
Reviews.Content: Pros: If you don't mind not being downtown the location is perfect. It's steps away from the lake, Lincoln Park, the zoo and much more. The views of the lake and downtown are great and the rooms, though a little outdated, are spacious and have everything you need. Cons: The front desk staff were not helpful and need to take a course in customer service. The hotel is beautiful when walking in but any good feelings get pushed away once talking to the staff. The bellmen at the front were the friendliest. The beds/pillows were quite stiff and there wasn't a business center. The rooms could have also been cleaned better, particlurly all the wood...finger spots everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful Belden Stratford, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: koi7
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this beauiful hotel. The staff now remember us from previous years. They are always helpful and friendly. We once again had a three week stay in a fantastic queen suite overlooking Lincoln Park, the Conservatory, the Zoo and the Lake.

Reviews.Title: “great location - if you are looking for something not in heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: apple422
Reviews.Content: My husband i were looking for a hotel to stay at while so we could go to a game at Wrigley Field - this was a perfect hotel. We took a bus (Clark 22) to the game. This hotel is also SO close to the Lincoln Park zoo - right across the street (great free zoo). The room itself was very large, but old and a little out dated. The roof top deck is amazing - great views.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: belle8221
Reviews.Content: This was such a beautiful hotel and great value when booked on Expedia. The views and rooftop deck from which to enjoy them, were so amazing. The location is in the really nice neighborhood Lincoln Park and directly across the street from the Lincoln Park Zoo (free!!!). It is walking distance to the beach, a $10 cab ride to downtown and Navy Pier. We were delighted by our stay here - the service was great (thank you Katie!!). Some travelers have noted that the hotel is dated, but that is all part of the charm, it is Chicago classic which I appreciate! As far as hotels go, this was a stand-out experience for me and my SO.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not helpful or friendly”
Reviews.Author: ReginaBubba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little old and dated. The room we where given was not even cleaned properly, it looked like a card game just finished.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but clean”
Reviews.Author: DanC21
Reviews.Content: I had very little interaction with the staff, but they were friendly when I did speak with them. Hotel room was spacious enough and very clean. The furniture and decor could use some updating, but those aren't real priorities with me while traveling. Can't beat the location... great neighborhood, close to buses and the L. Would definitely stay again. great view from the (popular) roof deck.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been awesome, but failed at check-out”
Reviews.Author: tacotacotaco
Reviews.Content: We rented a car for our weekend trip as this hotel was located a bit out of the city center. Long story short, we had an early morning flight and checked-out at around 5:30 am, only to be told that there was no way to retrieve our vehicle (valet's were off) and that we were not allowed to get our own car. After a lengthy discussion with the only hotel staff present, we decided we couldn't miss our flight and left the car to our friends (who were not on the rental car agreement) but luckily had a later flight. They offered no other suggestions and were less than helpful. The hotel is in a really nice residential neighborhood, our suite was a bit outdated but spacious and had a good view. Definitely would've recommended it, except for the poor customer service on our way out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but really bad service!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful and the location couldn't be better. If you like running along the lake, it's just minutes away. The zoo is literally across the street. There are some great restaurants in the area. The rooms themselves are in need of some updating but it was very clean. The service however is the worst I have ever experienced. The girl that checked me in was extremely rude. When I casually mentioned something about the high tax in Chicago, she got defensive and said I should consider myself lucky that we weren't in Canada. I had to ask how to get to my room, where to park my car etc.. When I checked out, there was no bellboy around and a maintenance guy had to help put my heavy luggage in the car! I won't stay there again. In the end, they are a high priced old hotel with terrible service. It's a real shame considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Jordan725
Reviews.Content: Lobby is very nice, but rooms and service are lousy. The room resembled that of a motel 6 except worse because the curtains leaked 90% of the light. The master bed was mediocre, but the rollaway beds were unusable. The rollaways were even worse than sleeping on the floor and one rollaway broke in the middle of the night causing my brother to fall through to the ground. We called the front desk and they were useless. Lastly, the continental breakfast consisted of 1 plate of bagels, 1 of cake and 1 of muffins. When the plate of bagels ran out, they simply said "sorry we don't have any more". By 9:30 there were only 2 pieces of cake left, and nothing else, so I was forced to eat breakfast out. Absurd since breakfast was supposed to run until 11:00 The lobby is nice, but there is no way the lousy rooms and terrible service warrant a 4 star rating

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful space in a great location”
Reviews.Author: justcap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week vacationing in Chicago, and stayed at the Belden-Stratford. The building itself and its lobby area are impressive. The rooms are not far behind. What we had there was more like an apartment than a hotel room. With its own small kitchen, a dining area, and a very large den in addition to the sizable bedroom and bathroom, the suite offered excellent comfort. In addition, we had a wonderful view from our den's windows of both the Chicago skyline and the zoo and park right across the street. It is necessary to take cabs from the Belden Stratford to get to the El or to other downtown transportation, but these cab rides were quick and not too costly. Lots of great Chicago sights and fun neighborhood activities are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “"We were pleasantly surprised"”
Reviews.Author: craftymom57
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard queen room with a kitchenette. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised to discover a beautiful old hotel with very helpful staff. To further our surprise we discovered we had a 1 bdrm apartment complete with a dining room suite! A continental breakfast was included. There is also a restaurant "Mon Ami Gabi" in the hotel. Guest laundry is open 24 hours. Our only heads up is regarding the cost. There was one washer and dryer that used coins. The remainder were with a card that you had to purchase and load. Just to purchase the card was $5, then we had to load it with what we thought we needed. From the rooftop patio you can see for miles. What an amazing view! Right across the street is Lincoln Park, the Zoo, and Conservatory. These are still FREE. The park is so beautiful and safe to walk in the evening too. Lake Michigan is a short 15-20 minute walk. There is a gorgeous beach front walk and a sandy and clean beach. Transist is very easy to use. We would suggest a 3 day (or more) pass. There are many restaurants within walking distance. One we discovered and highly recommend is "The Pasta Bowl". Wrigley Field is a short bus ride away. We will definately revisit the area and stay in this fabulous home away from home again. This property has residents and guests. It's a great quiet place to be in the city .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful outside, not on inside”
Reviews.Author: markandjulie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed alone at the Belden-Stratford for one evening while my son had orientation at a nearby university. It is a great location if you do not want to stay in the heart of Chicago. I had booked what I thought was a regular hotel room. It turned out to be what seemed to be a one bedroom, 1.5 bathroom apartment/condo unit with kitchen, living room, washer/dryer,... This was much more space than expected and had a great view of the lake and city (good thing) but unneeded and unwanted (bad thing). What I did not like about the property was that the particular room I was in looked like a time warp from 1985!!! This includes the furnishings as well as the bathroom and kitchen fixtures. Also, every time I sat on the edge of the bed, the mattress squeaked. For such a lovely location, I expected a better looking room and if it was not a traditional hotel room, I would have liked to have had this knowledge in advance. Also, parking was expensive (as expected) - $45 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent suite, good value”
Reviews.Author: Anthony066
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days during the month of April. We booked one of the suites that has a full kitchen. This was great and it allowed us to prepare a couple of meals in-house. The location is quiet (across from the zoo) maybe a little far from the city center if you don't want to walk. Bus service was not a problem and allowed us to get downtown in a short time. The room was very comfortable, no complaints. The breakfast gets a little boring after the 1st day. They have a couple restaurants serving diner only but we didn't get a chance to try.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Mingercat8
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a short stay at the Belden Stratford and it was wonderful! I came up early before a business comittment and couldn't get a room downtown. I found the Belden Stratford by chance on priceline at an amazing rate and it was truly the highlight of my stay in Chicago. The Lincoln Park area is lovely and this hotel is in a right in the center across from the Conservatory and Zoo. The neighborhood is quiet and nice with little shops and restaurants. The Belden was 100% better than the large downtown chain hotel I moved to the next day for my business event. The room was wonderful with a cute seating area, embroidered thick towels, a comfy bed, free wi-fi and a lovely morning view of Lake Michigan. I don't understand the remarks about the staff. I found them to all be helpful and friendly. My suitcase broke and one of the managers took me to buy a new one (thank you Susan) It was a really lovely couple of days and I plan to return with my daughters.

Reviews.Title: “Fab property in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BaronVonBrent
Reviews.Content: We booked this seeking value and a location slightly away from the immediate downtown. This hotel exceeded our expectations: across from the zoo, views of the lake, a bustling but quiet leafy neighborhood, more residential than touristy, and close to some great restaurants and shopping. A few blocks east of Fullerton and some wonderful places to eat and drop some dough (including a new Urban Outfitters Outlet) we'd definitely stay here again. The rooms aren't huge, but they are comfortable and quiet. This is a throwback that feels clean and up-to-date.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of over-charges on credit card”
Reviews.Author: MPDMaui_Hawaii
Reviews.Content: Thought I had found a great place to stay for family visits to Chicago--until they charged my credit card for an extra night they claimed I had booked while there. I flew out the morning of that "extra night" and certainly booked no extra nights! But it took multiple phone calls and my son calling to complain before they would remove the additional charge. Even then, they weren't very nice about it. Beware--and be sure to check your credit card statement carefully. (They actually suggested that I must have "forgotten" I had booked another night. Then they claimed it was non-refundable. It was also more than twice the price I had paid for one of the three nights I did book.) Now I am wary of ever staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Staff Ruin Great Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: Steveut02
Reviews.Content: A group of friends rented multiple rooms at this hotel this past weekend. The rudeness/refusal to pay attention to guests started at check in and lasted throughout our stay. How in the world the smug front desk guy that works on Saturday night is employed anywhere in customer service much less a hotel I'll never know. Someone else in our party had the room key and when I asked him for an extra so we could get back in the room to change, he told me "the guy that handles that is on break, he might be back in about an hour" - Seriously??? The only staff that saves this place are the bell hops and he was able to find me a room key in 5 minutes and told me the guy at the front desk is a joke. Until they hire a manager that has a clue how to manage (i.e., fire every incompetent employee in the building), I could never reccomend this hotel, despite the great rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NoWorriesGuy
Reviews.Content: At the last minute I needed to be in Chicago for business. The Belden-Stratford had attractive rates and looked nice online. I booked a queen and was pleasantly surprised. I arrived around 7pm and was promptly greeted by a doorman that took care of my car ($38 per night) and luggage. I mentioned that I would need my car in an hour so they left it parked conveniently in front of the building. Very thoughfult service! Check in was a breeze. This is an apartment/hotel so it had a very upscale-residential feel. The keys are old metal keys rather than key cards but the nice thing is that they also include a deadbolt key for additional security. The queen room includes a kitchenette which I didn't expect and did use. The building is old and beautiful and the rooms have a vintage feel and are not cookie-cutter Marriot or Hyatt. If that's your expectation then this might not be your place to stay. The room was spottlessly clean. My room rate included a basic continental breakfast which was appreciated. Another reason I chose this hotel is because of their restaurants. The have Mon Ami Gabi and L20. Both are high quality restaurants part of the Lettuce Entertain You chain. The down side is that these restaurants are only open for dinner. You must leave the facility for breakfast and lunch Location: just north of downtown, so it's an easy drive or taxi to Rush Street /Michigan Ave. area. Wrigley field is also nearby with all the fun bars/clubs. I also needed a late check out and it was granted without any issues or charges. It doesn't have a pool but at 23 degrees with snow, that wasn't an issue. Summary: This is a property that I would definitely return to for business or pleasure. The Belden-Stratford is a nice experience not vanilla Marriott/Hyatt/Sheraton. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly spacious”
Reviews.Author: crumpet69
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice and both times the room I had was massive - the suites are basically apartments. Remarkably good value for the space you get. Also in a great location, right across from the zoo. Very fine looking building, perhaps slightly passed its best on the interior, but a really nice change from predictable chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: wsc1963
Reviews.Content: First impression: A beautiful hotel in a great location. Walking into the lobby was a nice change from a "chain" hotel. Elegant. Finding our room was like walking a maze. There are no signs telling you which way the room numbers go and there was no direction from the front desk staff. The rooms were very large and clean, but badly in need of updating. The furniture was old and dirty/stained and the bed was like a board. We were looking for a lounge to have a coctail before dinner, but the hotel restaurant didn't open until 5. It was suggested we try a local liquer store and have it in our room. That worked out great seeing there is a full kitchen with wine opener and glasses in the room. The hotel restaurant, Mon Ami Gabi was fantastic. Overall, I enjoyed our stay and would consider staying there again. The location far outweighed any minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay with a bad ending.”
Reviews.Author: sinistas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Belden-Stratford for a week or so because it was located near a hospital my girlfriend was going to for inpatient treatment. The rooms were nice and roomy, although the furniture was definitely more "classy" than "comfortable". We had a suite with kitchen, and definitely got some use out of it. The staff definitely had its ups and downs. My girlfriend called to ask for extra pillows (she has neck problems) and the lady at the front desk didn't know if it was possible to get more, and never bothered to check or get back to us. Several times the doormen stood around and chatted with each other while we carried in bags, not bothering to even open the door for us. It should be noted that I'm not sure if they're employed by the hotel or one of the restaurants on the property, however. Lastly, I left a bag there by accident while rushing off to the hospital. Despite several calls, the bag just happened to disappear...Pretty disappointing considering the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: broomhilda04
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Belden, there is no luggage ramp per say. We had to drag our luggage up 3 or 4 stairs to the door and then again 6 or 7 stairs into the lobby. The door man was away when we arrived but we never did see anyone helping with luggage at the door throughout our stay. Maybe we just missed it, but if that's an issue for you, be warned. The hotel is in a very nice residential location. We had a one bedroom with full kitchen. Nice but dated. Most of the units are occupied with full time residents. There is a small workout room and continental breakfast. We didn't utilize either but the breakfast mainly consisted of danishes, muffins, juice and coffee. There is a laundrymat on site, but appeared to be for the residents. The hotel hosted a private party in the lobby, apparently for potential buyers for units they had offered for sale. We left and came back twice during their party and were grilled at the door each time about why we were there. Really?? I guess it didn't occur to them that they rented out some of the units to travelors and that was the only entrance for us to come back in through. It was a little annoying but not so much so that I wouldn't stay there again or refer to anyone else. They hosted a very nice Christmas breakfast complimentary to everyone staying, residents and travelors. It was delicious and everyone was very kind. Just keep in mind it's not really a hotel and has more of a primary residence kind of feel to it. Other than not being "luggage friendly", we really didn't have any complaints about staying here. The bus stop is not too far of a walk and takes you to Michigan ave very easily. $2.25 each time you ride unless you get some sort of pass which we did not. Make sure you have change. We took a cab a few times and that ran us anywhere from $8-$12 depending how far down Michigan ave we were. The zoo is across the street and had a light show going on for Christmas. Very nice. There are several restaurants within walking distance, honorable mentions are RJ Grunts (very affordable $7-8 sandwiches) and Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinders ($10-12 range). Starbucks is 3 blocks and an easy walk as well. We did have dinner one night in one of the hotel restaurants Mon Abi Gabi. Good food~ a little pricey. ($20 something per plate) It also has a nice little bar to sit and have a drink. Overall the experience was a good one and would definitely recommend the Belden Stratford.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug52Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel thru Priceline for $98 and it has been wonderful - we got a huge suite that has a bedroom, bathroom, big sitting area and full size kitchen! The hotel is grand, old and elegant. staff very polite and super friendly. The location is awesome - a short bus ride on the 151 Sheridan to downtown for $2.25 and the buses are super efficient and clean. The Lincoln Park Zoo and surrounding parkland is beautiful and you can see the city skyline from the Conservatory. All this just across the hotel. My daughter and I found so many little yummy restaurants (very reasonable) a few blocks down at the back of the hotel. Have to recommend the Zig Zag Restaurant at 2436 N Lincoln - the pastas are delicious! This hotel is great for families with young kids as there are outdoor playgrounds nearby. The Zoo is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Adds that extra special something to your stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: koi7
Reviews.Content: Returned again this year for another stay at this superb hotel in a wonderful location. The staff are courteous, friendly and more than willing to help you. The rooms are large, superbly decorated and spotlessly clean and everything you could possibly want is in the room. Travel to the city is just a few bus stops away, which if you are there for a week or so buy a travel card available from many local shops. The zoo is just across the road, as is the conservatory and the Lake is less than 10 minutes walk away. We cannot praise the hotel and its location enough. There are many quality restaurants within a block of the location. We will be returning again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrequenterOK
Reviews.Content: We drive 14 hours to Chicago every 3 months to take our young child to Children's Hospital. We stay here every time! They always make us feel welcome and take care of us while we are here. We have stayed in a variety of rooms and they have all been very nice. Being from the midwest they are not as friendly as what we are use to, but having been in Chicago a lot. They are very nice for this area. Especially when they get to know you. It is an apartment building for the most part, so it is not like your normal hotel experience. However, the location is great and the amenities are very nice. The spa was fabulous and there are many things that are easily accessible from the hotel. We travel with a 3 year old and a 8 year old and it has been great every time!!!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: phelbo
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and was greeted by a very nice young man, the rest of the staff during our stay, (which was 4 more days) was very rude, not helpful at all. If we did ask for help, we were greeted by roll of the eyes and no smile. The breakfast gal was super nice. She went out of her way to make us feel welcome. The room we had the first night was not good. The bed room was so small, dark room no window, the bed felt like a sheet of plywood. The bathroom was the best.!! the bathroom faucet had no water coming out of it, and, the so loose, you could almost take it off. We had to valet our car for a night. The next day we asked the front desk person to see how we get our car, in which she said she would call the valet person. We were waiting for about 15 mins. for our car. We then went back to the desk to see what happend, and the valet person forgot we were there!! And we were the only ones there. So as this person went to get our car, he did not appear to care to even get our car! Didn't say he was sorry or even acknowlege us. Thank goodness we were not in a hurry. But the time we needed to get to the airport, the desk lady said to us, "Next time you fly out of here, make sure you use Midway, O'hare is a terrble airport to fly out of" then she proceeded to tell us that she called a taxi. well, again we waited about 15 to 20 min. Saw alot of taxi's pass the hotel but not one stopped. So we flagged our own taxi from across the street. This taxi person told us that the light in which indicates that a taxi is needed wasn't even pushed. Even though our desk person said she would call a taxi. I could go one, but I won't. I will not stay here again. The staff needs to have an attitude adjustment.

Reviews.Title: “The Belden Stratford is THE Lincoln Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brintish
Reviews.Content: Any frequent guest of Chicago will inevitably begin to migrate north along the Lake Shore Drive into neighborhoods like Lincoln Park and Lake View. Michigan Avenue, after all, is stuffed from curb to wall with tourists and artifice. The shopping is world-class, but it's not the real Chicago. The heart of Chicago beats, eats and sleeps in its neighborhoods. The only problem facing the savvy Chicago guests, is that there aren't many hotels in Lincoln Park! Believe me, I've stayed at them all. The the only one worth staying at is the Belden Stratford, which as far as I'm concerned is my new Lincoln Park Hotel. And it may very well be the best hotel for the price in Chicagoland. The Belden Stratford is elegant and classy, a truly gorgeous building sitting on Lincoln Park West, overlooking the park, the Lincoln Park Zoo, and The Lincoln Park Conservatory (btw--one of the most underrated attractions in Chicago). The hotel staff are friendly and personable in an honest way. They know your name, keep things light, and make sure you're taken care of. I find that more comfortable than the fake "grateful subservience." The first room I settled into didn't receive a strong wireless Internet signal, which is important for my business. Tim the hotel manager personally scouted a new room for me using his phone to check signal strength! The next room was perfect. Full bars. And guess what? No surcharge. No "resort fee." Wireless Internet is free. That's just how they do things at the Belden, with traditional respect for hospitality from a bygone era. You won't find yourself attempting to cleverly empty an automated fridge full of $4 candy bars and cola's without triggering the dreaded sensors, just to make room for the $1.50 Sprite you bought at the Walgreens down the street. Quite the contrary, most rooms have a mini kitchen, with a refrigerator, stove top and microwave! It's efficient for extended stay business travel, when you don't want to eat out each meal. Breakfast is one meal you don't have to worry about at the Belden. The continental breakfast is pleasant, and also free! Bagels, croissants, cereals, coffee. It's well kept, and the dining area is pleasant. What more do you need? Okay, maybe mimosas and brunch, but that's what the hotel's Mon Ami restaurant and bar is for. Mon Ami seems to be a popular destination for locals. Always a good sign. Nice patio fronting the park. The prices aren't bad either. My visit happened to coincide with the annual air show that goes on over the lake. Lucky me! The Belden Stratford hotel has a rooftop deck. I watched the show perched far above the crowds. Can't think of a better Chicago Air and Water Show Hotel, even on Michigan Ave (which is too far south to really see the full show). Oh, and I think the Belden may be the only Lincoln Park Hotel with a full service spa, Vera Voli Spa. I didn't have the opportunity to use it, but I will next time, because I have a new home away from home in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room. Great location”
Reviews.Author: mikeyjhay
Reviews.Content: I can't praise these guys enough because I had booked a normal room, then told them it was our honeymoon, and they automatically upgraded us to a Bridal Suite for free! Great customer service. And the suite was incredible. Bigger than our flat at home and with it's own kitchen and two toilets. Plus an incredible view of the park, beach and downtown Chicago. Don't expect a great breakfast though. All they have is a tiny area to get simple bread and cereals etc.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: curiousvoyager
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised when our queen suite turned out to be a good sized apartment with high ceilings. Nice location right across from Lincoln Park. An easy ten minute bus ride downtown. In fact it was refreshing to stay in an area that seemed more like a real neighborhood than the glitzy touristy shopping area. This hotel is a very good value and I would stay here again when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old time charm”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: You walk into the hotel and are immediately taken back 75 years. Not in a bad way, though, but really charming. We had a very nice room, overlooking Lake Michigan and the zoo. The room was large and very clean. The bed was, however, hard, but that is the only complaint. The bathroom was nice and the towels are the softest I have seen in years. If I stay in this area again there is no way we would stay elsewhere. It is that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: tripgirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: When I first stumbled on the Belden-Stratford, I thought it sounded too good to be true. We were booking a weekend trip to Chicago for my sister's birthday and she lives in Lincoln Park, so I typed her address into Google maps and looked for hotels and this place popped up three blocks away for $99/night. I looked up reviews on tripadvisor and decided to give it a chance. We were very happy with the stay. They do make you pre-pay the $99 and it is non-refundable but we ended up with a 10th floor corner suite that looked over the lake to one side and downtown Chicago to the other. It was a shame we didn't spend much time in the room! The room, which was really an apartment, had a half-bath when you walked in, then a hall closet, very large living room with amazing views, dining room, full kitchen (which we didn't use) and then a master suite complete with laundry in the walk-in closet and a full bathroom with jacuzzi and double sinks. All for $99 in the perfect location! The furniture was outdated, but that is the only negative I can think of. There was also a complimentary continental breakfast included. They had coffee, juice, cold cereal and bagels, but it worked for us. There was also a small but adequate fitness room with a few cardio and weight machines. Valet parking was supposed to be $48 but they only ended up charging us $12 (still not sure how that happened, but I'm not complaining). Overallm, incredible value and fantastic location. We will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for location!”
Reviews.Author: ceruleandrew
Reviews.Content: I loved the location in Lincoln Park. It was walking distance to Park West, my reason for being in CHI. The lobby and exterior of the B-S was beautiful. The room, while small was neat and clean. Tony, one if the bellmen was just terrific! That enconpasses our upside of the Belden-Stratford. The downside was lengthy: the water out of the kitchen faucet was murky and stayed that way regardless of how long it ran. The bathroom sink/tub water was fine. The kitchen and bathroom floors were very slick, even in bare feet. Dangerously so. The room air-conditioning system was lacking. Even though the exterior temperature was in the low 50s, the room was warm. We turned on the AC and even after running for 10 hours, we slept without covers. Outside the room itself, the doormen were consistently so involved in conversation amongst themselves that we often opened the doors ourselves, which is fine normally. I'm just not really sure why they were there. The continental breakfast had one employee working it on a Saturday morning. During this time, there were no plates or spoons during the 45 minutes we were attempting to eat. He was apologetic but the spoons/plates never arrived. Plastic spoons and napkins sufficed. Luxury hotel?? When we checked out, we had 6 hours until we had to catch our plane. The B-S staff graciously offered to hold our luggage there until we returned from a walking trip to the Lincoln Park Zoo. One would think that the front desk clerk would relay this information to the bellman who, upon checkout, pulled our car around front...while we were walking through the zoo. Thankfully, he returned it to their lot when no one claimed it in a timely manner. When we returned to get our bags and the vehicle a few hours later. leave it to the bellman to give us some small measure of grief for not retrieving our vehicle upon checkout. Perhaps Barbie at the desk could have relayed said information to the guys so that they would have left the vehicle parked until we returned to leave later in the day. Striking, during our stay, was the lack of any obvious supervisory staff on a Friday night and/or Saturday morning/afternoon. This place screamed for competent supervisory staffing. Having said all this, I would return and stay at the B-S again, only if I was interested in an event at the Park West on S. Armitage. Why? Location, location, location! The Park West is a 10 minute walk away. (Even though one of the bellmen at the B-S told me that Park West on S. Armitage Avenue was 4 miles away. Thank God for Google Maps.) Come on, Belden-Stratford. Get it together!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price with a view of Lake Michigan and Lincoln Park Zoo.”
Reviews.Author: lisaplus5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two young children. For not much more than we usually spend at a budget hotel, we received an apartment with full kitchen, private bedroom and living room. Make sure to check out the sun deck. My only complaint is taht my reservation was for a Queen Bed with a Queen Sofa Bed. We didn't realize until it was quite late that there was no sofa bed in the room. I told the front desk and there was no adjustment to my bill. One of my kids slept with me and the other slept on the couch. The staff was overall very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is baked good and cereal with juice and coffee. With the addition of fruit and yoghurt, the breakfast offering could be better balanced. You just can't beat the location...amazing views and near the busline. Shopping and restaurants are within easy walking distance. We felt totally safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for a beautiful (elegant?) hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bingo47
Reviews.Content: In honor of a new baby joining the family we have made frequent trips to Chicago over the past few months. We have stayed on the North Shore in Evanston or Skokie, once in Lincolnwood. This trip I went alone and stayed at the Belden Stratford Hotel to be near Children's Memorial Hospital. The hotel lobby is beautiful, the front desk staff was courteous and efficient. The suite I had for 3 days would have been adequate for a family of four. Complete with kitchen, sleeper sofa and love seat, chairs, tables and desks, plus a full bedroom. The room's furnishings were not new but gave the impression of a kind of elegance. I didn't feel underdressed wearing jeans and noticed that many other guests were wearing the same. The bathroom was on the small side, but not tiny and was very clean. I never waited more than a minute for the elevators. The continental breakfast on the Arcade level was fresh and adequate. If I had driven to Chicago there would be questions about parking near the hotel, but the hotel might be worth the hassle to find on street parking. The hotel is in a good location, facing Lincoln Park Zoo, and behind it on Clark Street, restaurants and shops. Price was right (inexpensive) Five stays in Chicago hotels this winter, and this one is head and shoulders above the rest. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A suite for motel prices”
Reviews.Author: Lilosa
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Originally, we had been considering a different hotel, but several reviews of that other hotel mentioned problems with the elevators, so we kept looking. When we first called the Belden Stratford, I mentioned that my husband had recently had surgery and was using a walker so I needed to be sure there would be an elevator available. We then booked a standard room with 1 queen-size bed. When we arrived, we found they had upgraded us to a 1-bedroom apartment with beautiful views of the lake and downtown. The desk clerk explained that the larger area would make it easier for him to manipulate his walker. We were actually able to host a family birthday party in our spacious living/dining area! I noticed that some reviews criticized the staff. Although they didn't "fawn" over us, we found them to be friendly and competent, including the bellhop, 2 maintenance men we chatted with, and the woman managing the breakfast room. When we asked for a cab, the doorman had one for us in less than a minute, helped my husband into the cab, folded his walker and put it in the trunk. The location was perfect for us, much better than downtown or the airport, as our relatives live just west of the hotel. Immaculate kitchen and bathrooms, flat-screen TV's in living room and bedroom, and everything in working order. Lots of nice toiletries and more than enough towels for 2 people. Lots of hot water and good pressure--I could have stayed in that shower forever! Only one small complaint--lobby doors were very heavy and hard to manage when I was trying to open them plus help my husband down the steps--someone helping with the doors would have been great. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Suite with Great location”
Reviews.Author: jadorely
Reviews.Content: Hotel is elegantly decorated right by Lincoln Park Zoo within 3 min walk. Our room has a living room, dining room, kitchen, good sized bed room, 1 1/2 bathroom with tub and shower and surprisingly a walk-in closet with washing machine and ironing stuff. A family of 3-4 could totally stay in this room for a month ! Parking is expensive if you'd pay for velvet - about 40. We were lucky to find a parking pot right across the street by the zoo with no charge. But we did see a SUV parked by the road , whose window glass was broken from the theft on the way to Armitage Ave, that poor little kid was scared to tears. However, its nothing to do with the hotel. Belden Stratford is definitely great for family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service for Children's Memorial Hospital patients & families”
Reviews.Author: jppalooza
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this review is basically for those who are having to have treatment at Children's Memorial Hospital. Our daughter had to have surgery on a Friday morning, and since we are a considerable drive away, we came the night before and stayed for 2 nights. They do have a Children's rate, so ask for that. Also, parking is $38 at the hotel and only about $4 or $5 at the hospital, so my husband dropped us off at the hotel, and the parked at the hospital and he walked to the hotel. It is about 3 long city blocks from hospital to hotel. Children's provides a shuttle service to and from the hotel, so we used this the morning and night of her surgery. The "room" they gave us was called a mini-suite, and it is probably bigger than most people's first apartment. It had a king bed, and a large living room with a carpeted area. Also, only 1 TV with cable. It had a kitchen that had doors to close with a oven, stove top, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and full size refrigerator. The kitchen doubled as our daughter's bedroom because it had doors on it, we closed the doors and stuck her pack N play in there. The hotel provided the clean pack N play with a top and bottom sheet. The bathroom had tub and shower, but was a tight squeeze for more than 1 person in there. There is PLENTY of storage, Bed was comfortable. Clean. Directly across from the (free) Lincoln Park Zoo. We had a great view of lake Michigan. It was quiet and the hotel staff are friendly to children. The free continental breakfast was small, but adequate, considering we were eating on nervous stomachs. Check out was easy. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel and also tons of places to eat outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay at the Belden-Stratford the Next Time I am in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Lemontastypie
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay for 1 night at the Belden-Stratford, the room was the size of an 1 1/2 bedroom apartment with lots of room for 3 adults. Location right accross from the Zoo, Observatory and Park. Wonderful quiet location and a nice neighborhood. We stayed in Chicago for 4 nights and had booked our outher 3 nights at the Doubletree near Michigan Ave though Doubletreee was nice, no way as large or comfortable as our rooms at the Belden-Stratford. We had 2 bathrooms, living room, dinning room, fully equiped kitchen and another small room with a bed. Place was very charming and we all agree loved having all the extra space, would not stay any place else. The only problem you will need to take a cab to the center of Chicago which can run about $20, cab fair from the airport ran $30, but you can also catch a bus on the corner for a lot cheeper traveling into town. The hotel also offers free breakfast and has a lovely restaurant/sidewalk cafe. You must take a boat tour of the city, we picked up our tour at the New Trump tour. We went to the Chicago Art Institute which was wonderful, only thing would skip the 3rd floor, art on that floor was not our taste. Navy Pier is very nice, we went on a tall ship with a Pirate who told you wonderful true stories of the Pirates in Chicago. One of my favorite things was we went to a Chicago Cubs game and got to se the old stadium. Would love to go back to Chicago, just love the city.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe anyone would call the service friendly”
Reviews.Author: addison138
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel experience we have ever had. I would not recommend this place based on the service we encountered. I had family and friends staying at his place for our wedding. Not only did they give my fiance the wrong room they messed up my Uncles room. The women at the front desk were THE MOST UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF MEMBERS I HAVE EVER MET. They used profanity in front of customers, cut down the reservations staff, and complained. I can give an quote example, "This is [--], I am so sick of people today." The first hotel we have ever experienced were they DEMANDED the entire bill up front the second we walked in the door and lied telling us the price for the valet in/out parking service was a total of $38.00 per car. We thought, no problem, that's reasonable, until the day we checked out and were billed us close to 160 extra deciding then to say it was 40 bucks a day per car. I have never been so angry about the treatment at a place in all of my travel experience and this was my freakin wedding! Horrible. I can't believe those front desk clerks have not been fired as we were also advised by another staff member that there have been numerous complaints on their manners and their treatment of people. That's a stupid move on managements behalf because they turn away customers. My uncle and my fiance were beyond mad and they are two of the most laid back people I know. I will say on a good note and my husband wants to make sure everyone knows the bell hops and valet drivers were so nice and funny. They helped make an awful stay somewhat tolerable. Make sure if you do stay at this place to tip them well. They are great people! The views are outstanding, it's honestly too bad their front desk staff can't treat people better because the hotel itself has very cool potential.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Kari51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belden-Stratford last weekend for the first time. It was elegant, comfortable, friendly, amazing views, clean - and we hated to leave. We were also impressed with the wonderful continental breakfast and the amazing architecture and furnishings. The staff that we encountered, from check-in to maintenance people in the hall, were all friendly and helpful. It was a perfect location - across the street from Lincoln Park Zoo and walking distance to any type restaurant and shopping you could want. If you're lucky like us, you might be able to snag a good parking spot. Be sure to check out the beautiful view from the rooftop deck!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - a destination in its own right”
Reviews.Author: leech_family
Reviews.Content: This was a 4 night trip for our first ever visit to Chicago. In summary an excellent stay and I can thoroughly recommend the hotel; for the room, the lobby, the on-site â€œMon Ami Gabiâ€� restaurant and the location. Maybe we were lucky but for a standard room rate we received a huge suite and a great view across the park to Downtown (room 825 if you fancy asking!). Probably the biggest hotel â€œroomâ€� Iâ€™ve ever stayed in â€“ and I have visited a lot of hotels â€“ really a full blown one bedroom apartment. We really enjoyed being outside of Downtown. Apart from the great walks in the park (including the free zoo) and on the lakeside the location encourages you to get out and visit the interesting neighbourhoods of Chicago â€“ Lincoln Park, Old Town, Lakeview, Wicker Park. â€œThe Loopâ€� and Mag. Mile are fine, donâ€™t get me wrong, but we were glad to make that a visit rather a â€œstayâ€� location. As previously reviewers have said the public transport is excellent â€“ bus route 151 is a 3 minute walk from the hotel with buses every few minutes into the centre of the City â€“ routes 22 and 36 also handy (take route 72 to Wicker Park). Get one of the good value CTA passes - $14 for 72 hours. Recommendations outside of the hotel. Well to start the nearby walks are great â€“ not so much in winter I guess! Restaurants â€“ for brunch we enjoyed the Original Pancake House (Gold Coast) and Caffe de Luca (Wicker Park). For lunch â€œHeaven on 7â€� and Millers Pub, both in the Loop, and Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinder (Lincoln Park). For dinner Bistro Margot in Old Town (half priced wine Mondays!), the Chicago Chop House for steaks (expensive) in â€œNear Northâ€�, Mon Ami Gabi (at the hotel). We also ate at Gejaâ€™s Cafe (fondue) but over-rated in my view. The Art Institute of Chicago has a great collection worth 2 - 3 hours of your time. Donâ€™t believe your guidebook if it says free entry Tuesdays, that finished a while ago, the $14 entry is still good value. The Architectural Societyâ€™s boat tour is comparatively expensive at $28 but well worth it for the expert review of Chicagoâ€™s world class high rise buildings and general background on the city. If you are in the Wicker Park area check out the amazing houses on Wabansia Ave., on the other hand the Wicker Park â€œhistoric districtâ€� was hardly worth the effort. In summary Chicago is a great place to visit. Iâ€™d suggest outside of the cold winter months to make the most of the outdoor living opportunities; our September weather was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gordon78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a 3 stop US holiday this year. Nice foyer and we were able to check into our rooms early which was good. My room was a decent size with a kitchen area and breakfast bar. Friends had a larger room with a dining table and separate kitchen. Was good to have a fridge etc in the room, but it kept waking me up through the night. The room was clean and the bathroom a decent size. Didnt have any kind of a view. The complimentary breakfast was decent if not spectacular, but we were glad to have something each day before starting our sight seeing. Nice location. Very short walk to the bus which took us straight into city centre. Bought a 3 day ticket for $14 and cd use the buses, underground, and L line as often as we wanted. Tended to go into city centre for meals, but one night went more locally to the hotel and there was a decent choice. We didn't find the reception staff particularly helpful or friendly. My friends room had a hairdryer which didnt work and was reported twice and it wasnt replaced or repaired during the duration of our stay so they had to come to my room and use mine after their showers which wasnt great for them. Overall I thought the hotel was fine, tho not spectacular, but I would use it again and would recommend it to others as a good base for exploring Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: gettingoutofkansas
Reviews.Content: We got a great suite with a great view at a great price. The whirlpool tub was a great addition. We got a view of lincoln park and of the lake, Navy Pier and the Hancock center could also be seen. Classy dining room and living room in the suite. Grand lobby. Walk to public transport. Walk a few blocks for great dining or a little, but not much further to second city. We paid about a hundred and thirty bucks for this place per night, we should have paid the 300 they wanted for the weekend. Stayed at a chain hotel close to the El on our last day with much regrets. I have stayed in four and five star rooms around the world, but this is the one by which I judge quality. I wish almost that I could have just stayed at the hotel, felt bad that I filled my days so much that we just used the room mostly to sleep. Incredible staff, that knew us by name by the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LHubber
Reviews.Content: Stayed only two days in Chicago after a trip to Northern Indiana for a reunion. Would have planned a longer stay had we realized how great the Belden Stratford was. Excellent for those who don't mind staying away from downtown. We utilized the buses and the Red line to travel, and got to see plenty. The only disappointment was the cold rainy weather during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton for Embassy Suites Prices”
Reviews.Author: milkmaninflorida
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you are staying at a Ritz Carlton or the Plaza Hotel, but don't want to pay the premium price, the Belden Stratford should be right up your alley. The Belden Stratford is a combinatin hotel / apartment building. Our room, located on the 10th floor with an amazing view of downtown and the lake, was expansive! In addition to having a full kitchen, two baths, two big screen tvs. my wife enjoyed the full whirlpool tub seperate from an enclosed shower. The hotel is located 2.5 miles from the loop and 1.5 miles from Wrigley. We walked from the park to the hotel after a night game and felt perfectly safe. The buffet breakfast was convenient, although not as great as others have written about. If you needed to do laundry, there is a full laundamat, and a dry cleaner, in the hotel. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good old fashioned style”
Reviews.Author: DeeSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The deal we got on the net made it very reasonable. The lobby is so ornate and beautiful that you feel like you're walking into a palace. Our room was large and clean and had a fully equipped kitchen. We hadn't realised that the rate included continental breakfast - as much as you wanted. They even supplied paper bags for you to take croissants, etc away. The desk staff were helpful and the doormen too. It was in a nice area at Lincoln Park and there were some good restaurants and cafes nearby. It was opposite the Zoo and occasionally we heard a roar or two from the animals at night. It was easy to hop on a bus from the stop nearby to take you downtown. The buses were cheap and frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great for going to cubs game.”
Reviews.Author: olytrvlr
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel at a great price. Good location for going to cubs game. Nice neighborhood that felt safe and quiet. Service was good. Valet parking was a little high at $38, but well worth it for the room only being $99 on Expedia. Lincoln park is RIGHT across the street and we walked through the zoo in the park for Free in the morning while all the animals were out and there were only a handful of other people there. Great view of the lake. Nice atmosphere. Wouldn't recommend for young children, but my preteen niece loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased-hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: Portperson
Reviews.Content: A very very nice place to stay for a get-away to chicago. The hotel and our rooms were very clean and well maintained. My wife and I and our freinds did not have any complaints. All four of us loved the place. The least expensive room was a great deal for the price. My wife and I were upgraded to the 'presidentail suite'. That room was great. Enjoyed it so much. I never had a hotel room with a full and a half bath. The location was wonderfull. Across for the zoo and the gardens and only a short walk to Michigan Ave. All of us felt safe walking around after dark. It was a quick trip via taxi or bus to Grant Park/Loop area. We certainly stay there again. (visit the sky deck - great views!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: evergreen17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belden-Stratford for 5 nights in May 2009. Our room was large, and we had 5 closets! Also had a full kitchen and an amazing view of the lake. Don't rent a car in Chicago - parking is ridiculous. Use CTA - you can get anywhere you need to go. The staff was accommodating and friendly, and you get a continental breakfast each morning. Walk two blocks to great bars and restaurants. Overall a great hotel. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cymro36
Reviews.Content: As it was our first visit to Chicago, we didn't really know what to expect and chose this hotel largely on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews. Imagine our horror, then, when after booking a couple of not-so-good reviews appeared. We need not have worried. From the moment we entered we were charmed by it. Our room may not have been enormous, but it was quite satisfactory and the kitchen would have been very handy if we had had more than the few nights available to us - as it was, we did not want to spend time self-catering and decided to eat out instead. My wife's son, however, really hit the jackpot as for the same cost he had a suite all to himself and despite bribery and threats he refused to swap! Although not dead centre of the city, the location is great, facing the Lincoln Park Conservatory and Zoo, and once we sussed out the local bus routes we were able to get to most parts with ease. We had just come from a much more expensive hotel in Louisville and preferred this one. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but shabby”
Reviews.Author: ohara5150
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Belden-Stratford for 3 nights at the end of February. The lobby was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly. The room we had was quite large, but the bathroom is small. All the furnishings and decor were quite shabby and very dated. The room was clean as was the small kitchen (the oven was ancient). The restaurant, Mon Ami Gabi, was great. We got treatments at the Vera Voli spa, and while the decor there is very tacky, the massage and facial were excellent. Bottom line, the lobby appearance didn't carry over to our room.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: batesmotel77
Reviews.Content: The room was very large and comfortable but the service was ridiculously bad. We got lost on our way to the hotel and when we called the hotel we got a very surly employee who ultimately put us on hold (without asking) and then declined to give us directions (suggesting we just ask someone off the street). great. this level of unfriendliness was certainly consistent with the rest of our stay. Basically, if you like the zoo, its a great location and the rooms seem fine. but if your plans take you anywhere else its not particularly well located. Also, the "fitness center" is very very small, on the basement level, and the very limited equipment is quite old.

Reviews.Title: “Belden Stratford Rocks”
Reviews.Author: ccallen
Reviews.Content: Ok ,so you are not right on Michigan Ave., but being in the heart of Lincoln Park is not too bad. For the money ($100) Jan. 2009 this hotel/apartment was great. A full kitchen, big living room and bedroom were great for a family. Not alot in the way of services but you feel like a Chicago resident when you stay here. Was in Chicago to visit college student child who needed mom's cooking and a hot bath! This fit the bill. I will be staying here again when someone calls, Mommy, I need you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Belden-Stratford”
Reviews.Author: swenfennell
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Belden-Stratford and totally loved the hotel! We were looking at DePaul University with my daughter (hence the January visit), this was a perfect location. Even with the snow and cold - it was an easy walk to the DePaul campus. I had emailed the hotel with a question prior to making the reservation - the hotel Sales Manager called me back within minutes to answer my question - and gave me their "Winter Special" rate - $109 a night for a Presidential Suite! I don't know if we had a recently remodeled room - but it was lovely and clean - with a great view of Lincoln Park Conservancy and the park. It was about a $30 cab ride (without tip) from the airport, the area has many restaurants within walking distance - no need for a car. We walked to the "El" stop at Fullerton, next to the DePaul campus to go into town. The hotel even let us check in a little early and stay a while after the check-out time. I realize this was January and the hotel might not be as busy as summer, but it was appreciated. Check out RJGrunts down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Never had batter”
Reviews.Author: Thunderduckie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay here when we planned our trip last October to see the Genesis reunion tour at United Center. I had contacted the management and told them that this was going to be a speacial trip and that I wanted nothing but the best for my wife, as we don't get many chances to travel. When we arrived, we were greeted by a VERY freindly and courteous staff, clean and well kept lobby, and wonderful views. The front desk staff were very helpful and professional. When looking up our reservations, there were notes about my wishes, and that we were to be treated accordingly. We were given a room on the seventh floor with a view of the lake just as I asked. They also made sure to include bathrobes and a day at the spa for my wife. She loved it! (wink wink, guys) The room (apartment) was very clean and well appointed. We enjoyed great views of the lake, downtown, Navy Pier and the park. We are planning another trip to Chicago this winter (we want to see the city in the snow) and refuse to stay anywhere other than the Belden. We reccomend this to anyone wanting to have a relxed, peacful and enjoyable experience while in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $258 per night”
Reviews.Author: sharander
Reviews.Content: We were with a group for a wedding, so supposedly we received the "preferred" rate because of that. Other members of the group had been shown 2 rooms several months earlier and they were impressed by the spaciousness and lovely furniture. When we checked in, credit card information was written by hand on a paper form, completed by me with number, security code and my signature. No credit card machine was used. Arriving at the room, it took some figuring out to know which of the the 5 keys on the keyring to use to open the door. Upon entering the room, we were quite surprised to be in a small room, No lovely seating area or even a comfortable chair. There was a small table with 2 straightback dining room type chairs. As mentioned in other reviews, there was a kitchen behind a door with microwave, refrigerator, stove, dishwasher, coffee pot with a broken lid, and cabinets with basic supplies. In the bathroom, the toilet tissue holder was useless because there was no rod for the middle of the roll, so it sat on the toilet tank. The 3-way sliding shower door had every door off lhe track'; we never did get all the parts on the track so it was easily operable. The alarm clock was unplugged, and, of course, the outlet was behind the immovable headboard. There were no directions anywhere about how to dial room to room. When I called the front desk, I was curtly told to dial 7 first. Paint, wallpaper, and furniture was in need of sprucing up. We used the valet parking at $35 a night, and upon our return home 2 days later we discovered that the driver's side inside door handle had been broken as if the valet didn't know it was automatically locked and snapped the handle. The continental breakfast was adequate, the quality of the bakery being better than average. Upon checkout, I had to fill out another credit card slip for the parkiing, and when I asked why this was needed again, she desk clerk said because the other paper was in another folder. No receipt was given for either payment. Positive side-great location. We were directly across from the plant conservatory and zoo and could see some of the lake above the treetops. The hotel was quiet and the lobby beautiful Value?? We have had far better experiences at the HIlton and Congress hotel on Michigan Ave. at much less cost. All in all, we were disappointed after having made the reservations months earlier based on our friends' tour and the pictures in the brochure that came with our confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A_Real_Journey
Reviews.Content: If you're searching for a fine hotel in the Lincoln Park area of Chicago, don't look further than the Belden Stratford. The price of a night's stay was more than repaid by the hotel's proximity to Lake Michigan, The Lincoln Park Zoo, and Lake Shore Dr (affording quick access to Shedd Aquarium, the museum, Soldier Field, etc.) As other reviews make clear, the furnishings in this hotel are dated, but the layout is spacious and the rooms clean. The rooms are rather like small apartments than traditional hotel rooms. (In fact, very few of the rooms in this historic multi-story building are hotel rooms -- the others are full-time apartments.) My wife and I stayed with three of our children (ages 11, 7, and 7mos) in a one-bedroom suite. We slept in the bedroom, the baby slept in a crib in the kitchenette, and the other two kids stayed on the fold out sofa in the living room. Our other child (age 9) stayed with grandparents next door on the sofa (not a fold-out). All of us were delighted with the accommodations and, especially, the location. The irony was, we had a hard time dragging our children away from "Animal Planet" on TV to visit the Lincoln Park Zoo across the street. Valet parking at the Belden was available for $38/day, but I chose to self-park nearby. There is a lot west of the hotel on Belden where you can self-park for $35. (Why not use the valet service for $3 more?) There are several places to eat if you head two blocks west to N Clark St. I would recommend Ranalli's on Clark (corner of Belden and N. Clark) if the weather is nice. You can sit outside on their patio and enjoy good food at a moderate price. For other miscellaneous needs, there's a 7-Eleven at Clark and Belden and a Walgreens on Clark south of Fullerton Pkwy . Breakfast at the Belden-Stratford was pretty impressive. Their free continental breakfast included milk, water, and juice (in bottles), plus Metropolis coffee (a local Chicago roaster www.metropoliscoffee.com). Bagels, muffins, and sweetbreads provided the substance. My only complaint was that it was a trifle crowded, but our family made up most of the crowd, so who's complaining : ) If you're arriving for your stay on the train into Union Station, the best way to reach the hotel is by cab or bus. The #151 bus picks up on Jackson St just outside Union Station and drops off at Lincoln Park. (Check the CTA website at www.transitchicago.com for more info.) I don't know what cab fares would run, but you can't be more than 7 miles from the hotel. At night, be sure to take a walk to the lakeshore. There's a bikeway/walkway teeming with people, and the views of the city are wonderful. Make no mistake, the Belden-Stratford is not as nice as the Omni Hotel on the Mag Mile, but they don't charge you as much as the Omni, either. If you want to walk outside your hotel and into the Mac Store or a trolley car, stay at the Omni. If you want to walk outside your hotel and into The Lincoln Park Zoo (which is FREE) or onto the lakeshore, save money and stay at the Belden. We sure will next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place in Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: cbuck79
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Belden and were very pleased. It looked very nice like it did in the pictures. We tried checking in at about 1:00pm-because our flight arrived into town at 12-and were told our room wasn't ready. We weren't real please but it's understandable. We left our bags there and came back at 3:30. At this point there were 3-4 other groups waiting for rooms as well. We were finally granted our room about 4:15-even after others arrived, despite us having been "first on the list" to check in. The young, fat receptionist was rather rude but the older lady with a man's name (cannot remember the exact name) was really nice. Sorry for the odd sounding descriptions but that's the best I could do. The room was pretty basic. It had a dated kitchen but a nice bathroom. The toilet paper was in a VERY inconvenient spot-minor detail, I know, but wait till you see it too. All in all, the room was decent and clean. I only received a paper on the last day but I'm nitpicking. The bright spots? The location is great-in a very nice part of Lincoln Park just a couple blocks from Clark. Right across the street is the park and the Zoo. The staff was all very nice, save for the one. The breakfast was basically juice and assorted pastries and bagels. The atmosphere of the hotel was very calm and relaxing. There were very few young people around, even late at night. I think it's because the place is actually a condo complex with a few rooms that they rent out. I would definitely recomment this hotel for someone looking for relatively cheap lodging in the Lincoln Park area. Other than the initial problem everything else was pretty good. Granted, I'm not the pickiest traveller but it was very clean, nice atmosphere, and quiet. And the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers beware: Do not include this hotel in your plans”
Reviews.Author: Luckysdad
Reviews.Content: We had a big family event in Chicago, with people coming from all over the country. My wife booked two suites and two regular rooms three months before the event and paid for the rooms in advance. When we arrived at the hotel, the receptionist told us there were no rooms available and we would have to wait for the manager to explain it to us. She then refused to speak to us until the manager appeared--which he did after 10 to 15 minutes. The manager did not explain why all our reservations had been cancelled, merely that they had been and we were being redirected to another hotel. When I demanded to know why our reservation had been cancelled, I got a long, condescending explaination that if I knew anything about travel, I would know that this sort of thing happened all the time. In fact, in more than 50 years of travel, I can't recall it happening before: having not but four paid-for rooms being cancelled. We were told the new hotel was "a couple of blocks away." I asked for a map to guide me to the hotel and was told that none was available. I asked how to reach the new hotel and was told "just drive north and you can't miss it." We finally found the new hotel--at least 12 blocks rather than "A couple of blocks" away. The hotel was decent--even charming--but it had none of the features I needed. There was no restuarant or coffee shop, no valet parking, no suites, no childrens' beds, no cot so children could sleep in the same room as their parents. Parking was in a public garage--reached from the hotel by walking down a dark alley. We found other people in this hotel that also had been sent over from the Belden-Stratford. One party was told that because of a computer error the hotel had overbooked. Another was told that a big convention needed more space than expected. One party said they had spent two nights at the Belden-Stratford and were told after breakfast that they would have to move to the new hotel by noon that day. By my estimate, upwards of 15 people either had their reservations at the Belden-Stratford cancelled or were ordered to move after they had already spent a night or more there. I found the staff of the Beldon-Stratford arrogant and unhelpful. I felt they did nothing to improve a bad situation. This was a family event that had been planned for years and our problems with the Beldron-Stratford cast a pall over everything. I feel anyone who trusts this hotel risks being badly disappointed. There are many hotels in Chicago and no reason to risk having your trip ruined by attempting to stay at the Belden Stratford. If you need to be convinced, read some of the other harshly negative reviews other people have written.

Reviews.Title: “have stayed here many times”
